name: Train Simulator: Freightliner Class 70 Loco Add-On
summary: The Class 70 is one of the most distinctive UK diesel locomotive designs of all time.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 14 Loco Add-On
summary: The single six-cylinder engine locomotives were built in the mid-1960s by BR's Swindon Works, with the intention of working in shunting yards and short distance freight trains.

name: Train Simulator: BR DP1 Deltic Loco Add-On
summary: The powerful and impressive BR DP1 Deltic evokes the UK's glorious railway heritage, and this attractive prototype diesel locomotive is now available for Train Simulator. The amalgamation of engine manufacturer Napier & Sons and locomotive builder English Electric in 1942 opened up the potential to use the powerful Napier Deltic...

name: Train Simulator: CRH2A EMU Add-On
summary: Authentically crafted high-speed action awaits you with the striking CRH2A for Train Simulator! Experience an integral part of the Chinese railway network's modern history with this revolutionary locomotive.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 103 TEE Loco Add-On
summary: The DB Class 103 operated by DB, was considered the flagship of the DB fleet for a long period. It was up until 1987 that this locomotive monopolized high speed trains in Germany. It is one of the most powerful conventional electric locomotives ever built, with a one hour rating of 10,400KW or 13,900HP.

name: Train Simulator: Class 390 EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 390 is a modern classic, and you can experience the speed of this powerful tilting express train from the driver's seat in Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Chessie System U30C Loco Add-On
summary: General Electric established itself as an independent builder of mainline diesel locomotives in 1959 with its 2,500-horsepower U25B, and throughout the 1960s and into the 1970s, GE produced an ever-expanding - and more powerful - line of "Universal"-series diesels, which came to be widely nicknamed as U-boats.

name: Train Simulator: Canadian National SD60 Loco Add-On
summary: The Canadian National EMD SD60 is a powerful, stylish train, now available for Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Western Pacific FP7 ‘California Zephyr’ Loco Add-On
summary: The California Zephyr – the train many enthusiasts and railroaders alike considered the single-most magnificent passenger train to ever journey across America now for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: D&RGW SD9 Loco Add-On
summary: As one of the most unique and iconic six axle heavy yard switchers, the EMD SD9 was a popular locomotive among North American railfans.The EMD SD9 was a 1,750hp six-axle (C-C) diesel road-switcher powered by EMDs highly successful two-stroke 567C V-16 diesel power plant.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 24 Loco Add-On
summary: As the first diesel locomotives to be built at BR's Darlington Works, the Class 24 was built as part of the British Rail Modernisation Plan in the late 1950s. The Class 24 was a Sulzer Type 2, Bo-Bo diesel-electric locomotive built between 1958 and 1961, incorporating numerous elements such as off-the-shelf standardised components used...

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 35 Loco Add-On
summary: The mixed-traffic Class 35 diesel-hydraulic locomotive is now available for Train Simulator in BR green livery. The hydraulic transmission fitted to the Class 35 locomotives gave them their affectionate nickname of 'Hymeks' and, at the time they were built, were the most powerful diesel-hydraulic locomotive operating with a single engine.

name: Train Simulator: Merchant Navy Class 35028 'Clan Line' Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Operate iconic Steam excursions across Britain with Bossman Games' Merchant Navy Class 35028 'Clan Line', as preserved today in the classic BR Green livery!

name: Train Simulator: ÖBB 4020 EMU Add-On
summary: Introduced to handle commuter traffic right up until the turn of the century, and beyond, the ÖBB 4020 reigned supreme throughout Austria's key passenger routes - from the bustling cities to the rural mountain passes. Experience life in the cab of this classic unit as the ÖBB 4020 is ready for Train Simulator service!

name: Train Simulator: Norfolk Southern C39-8 Loco Add-On
summary: Take control of pure power with the latest entry to our Pro Range! Created in exacting detail and with a variety of realistic operating features, the Norfolk Southern General Electric C39-8 is a six-axle (C-C), 390,000-pound, 3,900-horsepower locomotive capable of tying onto the heaviest unit coal trains, yet also able to hustle...

name: Train Simulator: InterCity BR Class 370 ‘APT-P’ Loco Add-On
summary: Grow your collection with an iconic piece of British Rail history: the infamous Advanced Passenger Train Prototype.

name: Train Simulator: ScotRail Class 380 EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 380 electric multiple unit is a great modern image British train, and runs on the Glasgow Airport Rail Link route (also available for Train Simulator). A total of 38 Class 380 sets were ordered for introduction on electrified routes in Scotland. The 38 units comprise a total of 130 vehicles forming a mixture of 3 and 4 car sets.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 181.2 Loco Add-on
summary: This notable example of classic German electric traction, which has done duty for over 40 years is ready for you to command.

name: Train Simulator: UPRR Idaho & Omaha Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Smokebox brings to Train Simulator two more classic 4-4-0 "Americans" - Union Pacific sister locomotives No. 7, the "Omaha," and No. 8, the "Idaho."

name: Train Simulator: DB BR424 EMU Add-On
summary: The S-Bahn routes of Hanover are regularly served by the Class 424 electric multiple unit and are an ideal commuter train to accommodate the high volume of commuters passing through the City. Constructed from 1998 onwards, the Class 424 is similar in appearance to the DB Class 425 and 423 trainsets, but are better suited to the low...

name: Train Simulator: LMS Rebuilt Royal Scot Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Originally built in the late 1920s, the Royal Scot class of locomotive would see a radical change in their lives to become almost entirely new, Stanier-derived designs. Continuing their fantastic LMS line-up, Bossman Games have delivered yet another engine you need to have in your collection!

name: Train Simulator: Trainload BR Class 60 Loco Add-On
summary: While they have a chequered career, one cannot deny the power that a Class 60 can put down on the rails; having earned the nickname "Tug" from enthusiasts as it's what they do best, and now you can put them to work on heavy freight duty. Experience the might of the BR Class 60 in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: Class 2F Dock Tank Loco Add-On
summary: The diminutive Class 2F Dock Tank is here for Train Simulator, developed by MeshTools.The 0-6-0T short wheelbase tank engine was designed by Sir Henry Fowler for the London, Midland and Scottish Railway (LMS) who were responsible for operating lines on a number of docks.

name: Train Simulator: Dispolok BR 189 Loco Add-On
summary: The new-generation high performance BR 189 comes from the stable of successful Euro Sprinter locomotives built by Siemens, and is now available for Train Simulator.Classified as BR 189 by Deutsche Bahn, the Class is one of only a handful equipped with all four electric systems commonly used in mainland Europe and various light...

name: Train Simulator: South Wales Coastal: Bristol - Swansea Route Add-on
summary: Directly connecting England and Wales, running under the longest river in the United Kingdom, the South Wales Main Line is one of the most important cross-border routes in the country, and over 80 miles of it can be explored in South Wales Coastal!

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific FEF-3 Loco Add-On
summary: The final steam locomotive built for Union Pacific, the FEF-3, comes to Train Simulator from Smokebox with an extensive array of detailing and features.The FEF was a class of three steam locomotives built by the American Locomotive Company (Alco) and operated by Union Pacific Railroad.

name: Train Simulator: Network SouthEast Class 159 DMU Add-On
summary: As part of British Rail's popular Sprinter family of diesel multiple units, Class 159s were a popular sight on south west services from the UK's capital to the west of England.

name: Train Simulator: GWR 4200/5205/7200 2-8-0T Pack
summary: Step into the cab of a trio of Great Western Railway's hard-working tank engines, the original 4200, improved 5205 and huge 7200 classes, all brought to life in Train Simulator by Victory Works!

name: Train Simulator: DB ICE 3 EMU Add-On
summary: The ICE 3 is a fantastic new-generation high speed train introduced in 2000, and now you can take on the challenge of driving this serious train yourself!

name: Train Simulator: PRR FA-1 & FA-2 Loco Add-On
summary: DTM has now brought this long-awaited first-generation diesel classic – in Pennsylvania's classic Brunswick Green "single stripe" livery – to Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: SD40-2 Independence Loco Add-On
summary: The ever popular EMD SD40-2 is now on Train Simulator in a unique red, white and blue livery as operated by Union Pacific. More than 4,000 models were built by General Motors' Electro-Motive Division EMD between 1972 and 1989, as part of the company's Dash 2 series.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 145 Loco Add-On
summary: The TRAXX series of electric locomotives from Bombardier is responsible for many of Germany's more modern freight and passenger locomotives, including the BR 145, now available for Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: London Transport Heritage Collection
summary: London Transport's finest comes to Train Simulator with the London Transport Heritage Pack, featuring classic capital traction for you to enjoy. 1938 Tube StockAs their name suggests, the 1938 Stock was first introduced on deep-level 'Tube' lines shortly before the start of the Second World War.

name: Train Simulator: Epic Journeys
summary: Master your Machines with Train Simulator: Epic Journeys EditionEnjoy these three epic routes:SOLDIER SUMMITThe stunning plains and valley passes of Utah make Soldier Summit one of the best loved mountain passes of the western United States.

name: Train Simulator: CSX SD80MAC Loco Add-On
summary: Packing 5,000 horsepower and a 20-cylinder engine, the SD80MAC was a regular coal hauler across Pennsylvania, and is now here in CSX livery for Train Simulator. Thirty units were built by EMD for Conrail between 1995 and 1996 and were the first diesel locomotives to use a 20-cylinder engine since EMD's SD45 and SD45-2 models.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 648 Loco Add-On
summary: Expand your collection of modern German passenger trains with the introduction of the DB BR 648 to Train Simulator. The DB BR 648 is a two-car diesel multiple unit (DMU) built by Alstom as part of their Coradia family of multiple units. The BR 648 for Train Simulator is available in Deutsche Bahn Traffic Red livery and recreates the DMU as it operates today for DB on the Hamburg-Luebeck Railway route.

name: Train Simulator: CSX AC6000CW Loco Add-On
summary: One of the most powerful single-engine diesel locomotives in the World comes to Train Simulator, the General Electric AC6000CW.

name: Train Simulator: Boston & Maine GE 44 Loco Add-On
summary: The demise of steam traction in North America during the 1940s saw the birth of the hard-working GE 44 Tonner switcher, now available for Train Simulator in the livery of Boston & Maine, one of the most dominant railroads of the northern New England region.

name: Train Simulator: Southern Railway S15 Class Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Take control of an icon of Southern steam as the Southern S15 is now yours to enjoy in Train Simulator, courtesy of Partner Programme Developer, Bossman Games.

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific Challenger Loco Add-On
summary: The mighty Union Pacific Challenger 4-6-6-4 for Train Simulator, featuring four exciting and challenging scenarios specially created for the Sherman Hill route.

name: Train Simulator: Southern Pacific GP20 Loco Add-On
summary: The second generation EMD GP20 ushered in a new era of turbocharged locomotives on American railroads, and now this 2,000hp heavy freight hauler is available for Train Simulator in Southern Pacific livery.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 402 '2-HAL' EMU Add-On
summary: The Southern Railway's 2-HAL, a once-classic on the commuter scene, makes a comeback in this detailed add-on for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: GWR Star Loco Add-On
summary: In the late 1890s the Great Western Railway were seeking new locomotives as part of their post-broad gauge conversion modernization. The newly appointed Chief Mechanical Engineer of the GWR, George Jackson Churchward, sought out designs for modern steam locomotives that could serve the Western network far into the future.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 50 Loco Add-On
summary: The Type 4 Class 50 'Hoovers' were an express passenger locomotive that worked on much of the UK's railway network. Fifty of the Class were built in the late 1960s by English Electric at Vulcan Foundry Works and were exclusively used on the then non-electrified West Coast Main Line between Crewe,...

name: Train Simulator: Metronom ME 146 Loco Add-On
summary: The distinctive Metronom ME 146 is a great add-on for Train Simulator players looking to expand their fleet of German passenger trains, complete with matching double-deck (Doppelstockwagen) coaches and driveable cab car (Steuerwagen).

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific SD9043MAC Loco Add-On
summary: Climb aboard for some heavy freight-hauling - with the distinctive Union Pacific Electro-Motive SD9043MAC for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: BR Standard Class 6 'Clan Class' Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Recount the bygone era of Pacifics in Scotland, and provide a glimpse into the potential future where 72010 is brought to life in this exquisite Just Trains Pro-Range Add-on for Train Simulator! Following the nationalisation of Britain's 'Big Four' railway companies into British Railways in 1948, it was decided that many new steam...

name: Tropico 5: T-Day
summary: Every movie needs a set, and for this epic production, the whole island will be prepared for a blockbusting World War II movie. In 'T-Day', you must re-enact the defending of Tropico from its biggest-ever invasion and produce the greatest movie that the world has ever seen!

name: Tropico 5: Mad World
summary: Is this madness? No, this is Tropico! Find new ways of disposing unwanted opposition to your regime by installing the asylum, including straight jackets, isolation cells, electroconvulsive therapy and more!

name: Tropico 5: Surfs Up!
summary: Come with El Presidente on a journey through time and space in the new 'Surf's Up!' DLC for Tropico 5. In the not-too-distant future, Earth is under threat of alien incursion. The only hope for Tropico lies with the wise dolphins of the Pacific Ocean, who hold the power to veto this decision through bureaucracy!

name: Tropico 5: Supervillain
summary: El Presidente is getting tired of this ruthless dictator image, so he's decided it is time to become the most famous supervillain in the whole Caribbean.

name: Tropico 5: Generalissimo
summary: In this latest episode of Tropico 5, history is repeating itself while El Presidente prepares for all-out invasion and large-scale warfare! Build the majestic Defense HQ to instill fear in your enemies!

name: Tropico 5: The Supercomputer
summary: Knowledge is power. No one knows this better than El Presidente, who leaves no stone unturned in his quest to position Tropico as a leader in the world of technological progress. And, as any media or educational establishment on Tropico will tell you, no one has more knowledge than El Presidente!

name: Tropico 5: Joint Venture
summary: Construct a chain of Fast Food Restaurants all across the island.

name: Tropico 5: Inquisition
summary: On the beautiful island of Tropico, it never rains; El Presidente insists on it. So when the clouds roll in and the rain starts to fall you know something is on the way. Rumours are that a group of citizens have united to form a mysterious cult and have placed a curse over Tropico.

name: Tropico 5: Map Pack
summary: Penultimo presents: Five new island maps designed for your undisputed rule!

name: Train Sim World 2: DB BR 155 Loco
summary: The "Electric Container", as it’s affectionately known to railfans, has stood the test of time and you can take to the rails hauling heavy freight with a nostalgic twist, as the iconic DB BR 155 is now available for Train Sim World 2 for enticing Ruhr-Sieg Nord action!

name: Train Sim World 2020: Amtrak SW1000R Loco
summary: New and challenging railroading awaits you on the bustling Train Sim World 2020: Northeast Corridor New York route with this DLC that includes Amtrak's unique SW1000R diesel switcher and distinctive ex-Metroliner Cab Control Car.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak E8 Loco
summary: Picture the Electro-Motive "E-unit." For an entire generation it was The motive power for America's passenger trains – and now the elegant E-unit waiting for you in Train Simulator 2021 in the form of the EMD E8 in two classic Amtrak liveries!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak Acela Express EMU
summary: The Acela Express hauls North America's famous Amtrak high speed rail service between Washington D.C. and New York City.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak Dash 8-32BWH Loco
summary: The Amtrak Dash 8-32BWH diesel locomotive, constructed by General Electric in 1991, is one of the most unique and, among North American railroad enthusiasts, one of the more popular diesel types to emerge in the 1990s, and is now available for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak HHP-8 Loco
summary: One of the most short-lived electric locomotives for the Northeast Corridor – the Amtrak HHP-8 comes to Train Simulator 2021 for the stunning new NEC: New York-New Haven route. The 8,000hp, twin-cab electric HHP-8 (High Horse Power 8000) was manufactured by a consortium of Bombardier Transportation and Alstom for use by Amtrak.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak F40PH 'California Zephyr' Loco
summary: The F40PH California Zephyr brings together one of the most famous names and one of the most recognizable shapes in US railroading for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak P42 DC 'Empire Builder' Loco
summary: The ubiquitous Amtrak P42 DC is one of the most modern and fuel efficient diesel locomotive on the North American rail network, and is now available for Train Simulator 2021. Most notable for its streamlined, low profile single carbody design, the P42 DC is unique among North American diesel-electric locomotives because of its low height.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Grand Central Class 180 'Adelante' DMU
summary: The iconic Class 180 'Adelante' speeds into Train Simulator 2021 in distinctive Grand Central Trains livery. The five-car sets were built by Alstom at their Washwood Heath plant between 2000 and 2001 for First Great Western, who wanted to increase the frequency of their express services between London Paddington and South Wales.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak SDP40F Loco
summary: Amtrak's Electro-Motive SDP40F – a memorable, historic, yet star-crossed diesel locomotive of the 1970s and early 1980s – now comes to Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak P30CH Loco
summary: The General Electric P30CH, affectionately nicknamed the "Pooch," was among the first all-new diesel-electric locomotives built for Amtrak, and is now available for Train Simulator 2021. Nicknamed after the similarities in its P30CH designation, the "Pooch" locomotives were designed around General Electric's 3,000-horsepower U30C.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Amtrak E8 Scenario Pack 01
summary: Take the throttle of Amtrak's stylish and historic Electro-Motive E8 and highball famous American passenger trains in Amtrak E8 Scenario Pack 01!

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR Large Prairies Steam Loco
summary: The distinctive and incredible GWR Large Prairies comes to Train Simulator 2021 to fulfill a multitude of steam-era roles.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR Small Prairies Loco
summary: As small mixed traffic branch locomotives, the Great Western Railway's Prairies were diminutive workhorses of the railway network, and are now available for Train Simulator 2021. The 2-6-2 tank engines were introduced to the GWR in 1904 with the 4400 Class, primarily for use on the railway's numerous hilly branch lines.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Soldier Summit Scenario Pack 01
summary: Rugged, challenging, and realistic western mountain railroading awaits you in Soldier Summit Scenario Pack 01.

name: Train Simulator 2021: SW1500 Switcher Loco
summary: The SW1500 is a classic example of a US yard switcher, and the different color schemes and variants.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Southern Class 455/8 EMU
summary: One of London's iconic commuter electric multiple units comes to Train Simulator 2021 in Southern Trains livery. Originally starting life as a Class 510, the Class 455/8 was introduced in 1982 to replace the aging 4SUB and 4EPB units. Class 455/8s were part of the first batch of units to be delivered between 1982 and 1984.

name: Train Simulator 2021: NJ TRANSIT ALP-46 Loco
summary: With a 1,000-mile route system, much of which is electrified with overhead AC catenary, commuter carrier NJ TRANSIT is one of North America’s primary employers of electric locomotives. Seeking a new fleet of state-of-the art electrics, NJ TRANSIT contracted with Adtranz (now part of Bombardier) in Kassel, Germany.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Robinson Class O4 Loco
summary: The Robinson O4 is a workhorse from the days of British steam, and you can now drive this faithful old 'kettle' in Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: PRR Alco RS11 Loco
summary: Built between 1956 and 1964, the RS-11 was Alco's answer to the EMD GP9 and was fitted with a turbo charger and had a heavy pulling power of 1,800hp, making it an ideal heavy freighter but also saw some passenger service in its lifetime.

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 4010 EMU
summary: Traverse the landmark Semmeringbahn route in the newly unveiled ÖBB (OEBB) 4010, from noted Partner Programme developer RSSLO. This flagship of the ÖBB promises authenticity abounds as it arrives for Train Simulator 2021 service!

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 18 Steam Loco
summary: A true legend makes its way to Train Simulator 2021 in the form of the DB BR 18, the pinnacle of German Pacific design. Shortly after the turn of the 20th Century, locomotive designers of the Maffei company were working on a development of Germany's first Pacific locomotive - the Baden IV f - to provide a new, more powerful iteration.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Class 3F 'Jinty' Loco
summary: The diminutive Class 3F 'Jinty' 0-6-0 tank engine, designed by Henry Fowler and based on the Midland Railway Class 2441, is now available for Train Simulator 2021 in a number of LMS and BR liveries. In total, more than 400 of these locomotives were built between 1924 and 1931, originally for the London, Midland and Scottish Railway.

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 411 'ICE-T' EMU
summary: The seven-car BR 411 'ICE-T' was the first tilting train to enter service on the German railway network, and now joins the stable of ICE trains for Train Simulator 2021. The ICE-T was developed by Siemens in parallel with the ICE 3 and ICE TD in the early 1990s, designed to operate on lines previously served by slower loco-hauled InterCity.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Stanier Class 5 'Black Five' Steam Loco
summary: A total of 842 "Black Five" locomotives were built for the London, Midland and Scottish and later British Railways; and, a truly definitive add-on is unleashed, in the form of LMS Stanier Class 5!

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 642 DMU
summary: Built to serve the quieter communities of Germany, the DB BR 642 upholds the high standard of comfort and reliability expected from the 'Desiro' family of multiple units. The BR 642 is ready for virtual service and is packed with advanced features.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GP40-2 Loco Pack
summary: The Electro-Motive GP40-2 has been a versatile workhorse of American railroading for more than four decades - and now the classic second-generation diesel locomotive comes to Train Simulator 2021 in the authentic liveries of five famed U.S. railroads!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern Big 7s Loco
summary: The Norfolk Southern Big 7s add-on brings two variations of the GE Dash 7 locomotive to Train Simulator 2021. The 3,600 horsepower four-axle GE B36-7 was built from 1980 until 1985 as successor to the famous U36B 'U-Boats'.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Virgin Trains BR Class 390 'Pendolino' EMU
summary: Be enticed by the Class 390 'Pendolino' – one of the most intriguing trains ever built! Combining the contentious 'tilting' technology of the Advanced Passenger Train with Alstom's ETR 401s, the Pendolino was the first to bring comfortable tilting to British rails - and at speeds of up to 125mph!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Duchess of Sutherland Loco
summary: One of the most powerful passenger steam locomotives ever to be built for the British railway network - the Coronation Class 'Duchess of Sutherland' - comes to Train Simulator 2021 in its fantastically preserved BR Brunswick Green livery.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR Nunney Castle Steam Loco
summary: One of the most well-liked and successful locomotives of the Great Western Railway, 5029 Nunney Castle depicted in preservation form, steams into Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: NJ TRANSIT F40PH -2CAT Loco
summary: Electro-Motive's F40PH line of diesel locomotives represented the face of North American passenger railroading for more than a generation. Between 1976 and the early 1990s, more than 400 of the highly successful 3,000- and 3,200-horsepower diesel locomotives were constructed and served in intercity and commuter service.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR Steam Railmotor Loco
summary: The unusually designed forerunner to more modern diesel and electric multiple units, the GWR Steam Railmotor, has arrived in Train Simulator 2021, offering one of the most unique driving experiences ever. In the early 1900s, the introduction of electric street tramcars and motor buses provided competition to suburban and branch line services.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LNWR G2 Super D Steam Loco
summary: Designed as a successor to the LNWR's extensive 0-8-0 fleet, which had lineage dating back to the 1890s, the G2 Class surfaced in the 1920s and, thanks to its developments, was able to dominate the LNWR and LMS network right through to the end of steam.

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 643 DMU
summary: The DB BR 643 from RSSLO captures the finesse of the "Talent" in Pro Range fashion, and is perfectly suited for authentic local DB Regio operations!

name: Train Simulator 2021: DR BR 44 Loco
summary: First appearing in 1926, the DR BR 44 was designed to haul heavy goods over steep gradients, and now you can recreate historic action aboard the "Jumbo"!

name: Train Simulator 2021: LNER/BR Class J94 Loco
summary: The Hunslet LNER/BR J94 saddle tank is now available for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: CSX NRE 3GS-21B 'Genset' Loco
summary: One of the most innovative, efficient, and unique diesel locomotives in service on today's US railroads is now available for Train Simulator 2021 - the CSX NRE 3GS-21B 'GenSet'. Built by National Railway Equipment since 2006, the 3GS-21B has proven itself the most successful of the growing number of GenSet locomotives.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Seaboard GE U36B Loco
summary: The famous General Electric 'U-Boat' comes to Train Simulator 2021 in two distinctive Seaboard liveries. General Electric introduced its "Universal Series" diesel road-switchers in 1959, and over the following two decades more than 3,500 "U-Boats" - as the locomotives were nicknamed - were constructed.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Freightliner Class 57/0 Loco
summary: The 'bodysnatching' Class 57/0 in Freightliner livery is now available for Train Simulator 2021. The Class 57/0 was introduced as a rebuilt version of the redundant Class 47, and externally both classes look the same.

name: Train Simulator: UK Military Wagon Pack
summary: Take charge of important rail operations with Train Simulator 2021's UK Military Wagon Pack.

name: Train Simulator 2021: PRR RF-16 'Sharknose' Loco
summary: The distinctive Baldwin RF-16 with 'Sharknose' design comes to Train Simulator 2021, from Digital Train Model. In 1948, Baldwin Locomotive Works began to apply a new 'Sharknose' body style to its cab unit diesel locomotives, partly to differentiate Baldwin locomotives from its competitors.

name: Train Simulator 2021: EWS Class 66 v2.0 Loco
summary: When British Rail's freight operations were privatized in 1996, EWS brought most of BR's freight operations, including many locomotives that were unreliable or at the end of their useful life.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BNSF ES44DC Loco
summary: New emission standards for diesel locomotives in the US introduced in 2005 saw many new locomotives enter service to replace more ageing fleets, including the Evolution Series of locomotives and the ES44DC, now available for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Koeln Airport Link Route Extension
summary: Gear up for Planes, Trains and Stadtschnellbahns! The incredible Rhine Railway has linked Troisdorf and Cologne via both the impressive Gremberg yard and the Hohenzollern Bridge since 1874.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Sectors Class 56 Loco
summary: The heavy freight second generation Class 56 diesel locomotive comes to Train Simulator 2021 in BR Sectors livery. Built for British Rail between 1976 and 1984, the first batch of 30 locomotives were built by Electroputere in Romania as a replacement to aging fleets of first generation locomotives such as the Class 37 and Class 47.

name: Train Simulator 2021: MRCE ES 64 U2 'Taurus' Loco
summary: One of the most modern and most powerful locomotives for cargo and passenger transport in Europe has arrived for Train Simulator 2021. The MRCE ES 64 U2 'Taurus' is a new generation high performance electric locomotive built by Siemens between 2000 and 2008, and part of the second generation of Eurosprinter locomotives built by the company.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 421 '4CIG' Loco
summary: Once a very familiar sight across the railways of southern England, the 4CIG electric multiple unit is a classic example of the heritage 'slam-door' passenger trains which once formed the backbone of southern passenger services.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BNSF Dash 9 Loco
summary: The Dash 9 brings some heavy hauling to Train Simulator 2021, and with a great mix of liveries it is perfect for North American railfans.

name: Train Simulator 2021: San Diego Commuter Rail F59PHI Loco
summary: Built by General Motors Electro-Motive Division, the F59PHI is most commonly used on passenger trains throughout North America. Most significantly, it was also the first train to meet California's strict emission standards, a feature that has seen its use across North America.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Class A4 Pacifics Loco
summary: The record-breaking streamlined Class A4 Pacifics were the flagships of prestigious high-speed steam travel in the UK, and the six surviving 'Streaks' are now available for Train Simulator 2021 in one special Gathering.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Union Pacific GP50 Loco
summary: The GP50 was the first model built by General Motors' Electro-Motive Division to be equipped with microprocessor controls, similar to GE's Dash 8 Series, which EMD saw as the main competitor to its own four-axle model.

name: Train Simulator 2021: London Overground Class 378 'Capitalstar' EMU
summary: One of the most modern electric multiple units (EMUs) for the London rail network comes to Train Simulator 2021, a perfect accompaniment for the South London Network route. The Class 378 'Capitalstar' was first introduced to service in 2009 to replace aging classes of EMUs in service around London.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 101 DMU
summary: Produced by Metro-Cammell in Birmingham, the Class 101 was considered to be one of the most successful first generation diesel multiple units ever produced by British Rail, and is now available for Train Simulator 2021 in familiar BR liveries.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Western Hydraulics Pack
summary: Recount the iconic and distinctive hydraulics in this bumper package for Train Simulator 2021 featuring BR Class 35, BR Class 42 and BR Class 52 locomotives as they were in their heyday.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Stroudley A1/A1X Class 'Terrier' Steam Loco
summary: The 145-year-old Terrier is a legendary locomotive, serving southern England for a generation, and now available for you to own in Train Simulator 2021. Fall in love with one of the most iconic steam engines ever to operate on Britain's railways and re-live the days of yesteryear.

name: Train Simulator 2021: First Capital Connect Class 321 EMU
summary: Considered to be one of the most reliable and trouble-free EMUs of the Mk3 family, the Class 321 is a popular commuter train operated by a number of companies across the UK, and now available for Train Simulator 2021 in First Capital Connect livery.

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 204 Loco
summary: Shunting magnificence comes to life on the island of Rügen with the classic DB BR 204 for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 1044 Loco
summary: The ÖBB (OEBB) 1044 electric locomotive was built by ELIN, Siemens Mobility, Brown, Boveri & Cie. and Simmering-Graz-Pauker in the mid-1970s as a powerful solution to Austria's challenging rail network, being able to haul heavy freight or bustling passenger services anywhere from heaving cities to rural mountain passes with ease.

name: Train Simulator 2021: MRCE BR 185.5 Loco
summary: The modular TRAXX locomotives from Bombardier have become one of Europe's most widespread family of locomotives and includes the BR 185.5, now available for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: PRR DR6-4-2000 & Broadway Limited Loco
summary: The Pennsylvania Railroad was legendary - and this remarkable pack from DTM brings together two Pennsy classics - PRR’s distinctive Baldwin DR-6-4-2000 "passenger shark" diesels and the railroad's flagship passenger train, the Broadway Limited!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Metro-North Kawasaki M8 EMU
summary: One of the newest electric multiple units for the Northeast Corridor comes to Train Simulator 2021 in Metro-North's familiar bare metal and red livery. Built by Kawasaki at Lincoln, Nebraska for use on the New Haven Line, the M8 first entered service in March 2011 as a replacement to the current fleet of M2, M4 and M6 multiple units.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Class 325 EMU
summary: The Class 325 is a striking dual-mode electric train, ideal for high-speed mail haulage in Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern SD40-2 High Nose Long Hood Forward Loco
summary: General Motors' bestselling SD40-2 diesel locomotive comes to Train Simulator 2021 in Norfolk Southern black livery in its popular high nose, long hood variant. Around 4,000 models of the Dash 2 series locomotive were built between 1972 until 1989 as an upgrade to the SD40.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Union Pacific GP30 Loco
summary: At a time when US locomotive builders were vying for more horsepower, General Motors' Electro-Motive Division introduced the new generation GP30 that was later to become a hugely successful diesel-electric locomotive for many US Class I railroads.

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 1293 Loco
summary: Experience modern Austrian traction first hand, as the state-of-the-art ÖBB (OEBB) 1293 arrives for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB Schenker Class 59/2 Loco
summary: The first of the heavy freight generation of locomotives and pivotal in bringing the most successful freight locomotive in the UK to life, the BR Class 59 comes to Train Simulator 2021 in modern DB Schenker livery. The original four Class 59s were ordered by Foster Yeoman in 1985 as a replacement to the increasingly unreliable Class 56.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Corris Railway Expansion Pack Loco
summary: Experience industrial narrow gauge along the Corris Railway with this expansion pack for Train Simulator 2021, featuring No. 5 "Alan Meaden" and No. 9 "Aberllefenni".

name: Train Simulator 2021: CRH 380A High Speed Train
summary: The breathtakingly fast CRH380A comes to Train Simulator 2021 for authentic and blinding Chinese high-speed action. Following the introduction of passenger-dedicated high-speed railways throughout China in 2007, several iterations of modern-age multiple units have been manufactured.

name: Train Simulator 2021: MRCE Dispolok Pack Loco
summary: Bring powerful locomotives and hefty freight to life with the action-heavy MRCE Dispolok Pack! With a rich history and lots to play with, this pack is the perfect way to freshen up your collection.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 87 Loco
summary: The Class 87 was the last purpose built electric locomotive for the West Coast Main Line following electrification of the line north of Crewe, and now you can take control of British Rail's flagship electric model in Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: D&RGW SW1200 Loco
summary: Electro-Motive's quintessential diesel switcher, in the classic form of the EMD SW1200 outfitted in stunning D&RGW (Rio Grande) livery, comes to Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 31 Loco
summary: The classic Class 31 diesel locomotive was a versatile workhorse of the British railway network, and now this Brush Type 2 is available for Train Simulator 2021 in BR Railfreight Sector and preserved BR Green liveries. British Railways' 'Pilot Scheme' to replace steam traction saw 20 Type 2 diesel locomotives built by Brush Traction in 1957.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Southern Pacific GS-4 Loco
summary: The Southern Pacific GS-4 is one of the United States' most iconic steam locomotives, and these colorful steamers are available for you to drive in Train Simulator 2021. Southern Pacific ordered a total of 28 Class GS-4 ("Golden State") locomotives from Lima Locomotive Works, with streamlined Daylight livery.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Stanier Class 8F Steam Loco
summary: Step back in time to an era of soot and steam with Bossman Games' authentic LMS Stanier Class 8F for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: PRR Baldwin Centipede Loco
summary: The Baldwin Centipede was one of the more unusual and heavy diesel locomotives in US railroading history.

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 1014 Loco
summary: The remarkable ÖBB (OEBB) 1014 has joined the Train Simulator 2021 library, and in doing so brings you a modern-classic to life in authentic detail to add to your collection.

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 5047 DMU
summary: Experience the quaint ÖBB (OEBB) 5047, which has arrived for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: CSX C30-7 Loco
summary: General Electric’s "Dash 7" line of diesel locomotives was introduced in 1976 and promised better fuel efficiency, and improved reliability as compared to GE's older generation of famed "U-boats." The first of the GE Dash 7 line to enter production was the six-axle, 3,000-horsepower C30-7.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Southwestern Expressways - Reading: Exeter Route
summary: Hundreds of miles and detail galore, Just Trains’ Southwestern Expressways spans 4 counties and is ready to be explored now in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator 2021: CPRR 4-4-0 No. 60 'Jupiter' Steam Loco
summary: It was on May 10, 1869 at Promontory, Utah that the "Golden Spike" ceremony made America one land, linked by rail from ocean to ocean. Facing each other on that historic day were two locomotives, Union Pacific 4-4-0 No. 119 and Central Pacific No. 60, the Jupiter.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Great Northern F7 'Empire Builder' Loco
summary: The hugely popular EMD F7 has hauled some of North America's most celebrated passenger trains, including Great Northern's Empire Builder, and is now available in this famous consist and livery for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: East Midlands BR Class 222 DEMU
summary: Experience a prime example of modern-day traction with Just Trains' detailed BR Class 222 for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 45 'Peak' Loco
summary: The 'Peak' of British Railway's diesel fleet comes to Train Simulator 2021 in original BR blue livery. Built by BR's Derby and Crewe Works between 1960 and 1962, the Sulzer Type 4 diesel locomotive were the main passenger locomotives on the Midland Main Line from their introduction until their withdrawal in the early 1980s.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Union Pacific No. 119 Steam Loco
summary: The captivating experiences of "Old West" American railroading awaits you with historic Union Pacific 4-4-0 No. 119 and its accompanying Cheyenne 1869 route for Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern Heritage SD70ACes Loco
summary: In 2012, Norfolk Southern celebrated its 30th anniversary and honored some of the railroads in its history by repainting 20 locomotives in 'fallen flag' liveries. Since the 1820s, hundreds of railroad companies were built, merged, reorganized and consolidated into what eventually became Norfolk Southern in 1982.

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 261 'Voith Gravita' Loco
summary: One of the most eagerly awaited German locomotives for Train Simulator2021, the DB BR 261 'Voith Gravita' is now available in distinctive Deutsche Bahn livery. The DB BR 261 10BB built by Voith, and named internally as the 'Gravita', is a diesel-hydraulic shunting freight locomotive able to operate over medium capacity main line freight.

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 442 'Talent 2' EMU
summary: The new generation BR 442 'Talent 2' comes to Train Simulator 2021, perfect for you to experience on the Munich - Garmisch-Partenkirchen route.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 419 MLV BEMU
summary: The bespoke BR Class 419 comes to Train Simulator 2021, and is perfect for any Southern Region motor-luggage hauling in this enhanced Pro Range reproduction.

name: Train Simulator 2021: North London & Goblin Lines
summary: Stretching across North and East London, the Gospel Oak to Barking Line - affectionately known as the ‘GOBLIN’ - has grown into a major part of the extensive London Overground network; a network which has specialized in re-vitalizing neglected routes throughout the Capital, converting them into railways which are fit to serve modern-day.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Coronation Class "Duchess of Hamilton" Loco
summary: Once a record-breaking steam locomotive admired by many on the UK's rail network, the LMS Coronation Class 'Duchess of Hamilton' comes to Train Simulator 2021 in its striking streamlined variant. The LMS Coronation Class was a mainline steam locomotive designed by William Stanier and built at Crewe Works between 1937 and 1948.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Class 455 EMU
summary: The Class 455 EMU is typical of the new generation of multiple units introduced in the 1980s to replace aging and out-dated 'heritage' units.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Return to Maerdy Loco
summary: Train Simulator 2021: Return to Maerdy Loco is an add-on for Train Simulator 2021, complete with the unique English Electric Type 3B Battery Locomotive and WD Hunslet 0-6-0ST 'Austerity'.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 170 'Turbostar' DMU
summary: The Class 170 Turbostar is a great modern passenger train which is perfectly at home on any UK Train Simulator 2021 route.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR 7800 'Manor' Class
summary: Climb aboard classic steam power with Train Simulator 2021's DLC GWR 7800 'Manor' Class.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 31 Freight Loco
summary: The Class 31 is a classic British workhorse just waiting to get to work in Train Simulator 2021.

name: Train Simulator 2021: London Overground BR Class 313 EMU
summary: Built to revolutionise suburban travel on newly electrified lines in Britain's capital, the Class 313 was the forerunner of British Rail's Second Generation production fleet and would start a history that is still being written to this day.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Western Maryland Railway Retro Pack
summary: The Western Maryland Railway Retro Pack, developed by High Iron Simulations, includes everything you need to step back in time to the late 1960s and early 1970s and go to work for the famed railroad that was nicknamed "The Wild Mary."

name: Train Simulator 2021: DB BR 120 Loco
summary: One of the most versatile German electric locomotives, the BR 120, is now here for Train Simulator 2021 in distinctive Deutsche Bahn 'Regio' livery. The BR 120 was originally designed to replace the impressive BR 103, and was one of the first electric locomotives to feature three-phase motors.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Regional Railways Class 101 DMU
summary: As one of the largest classes of first generational diesel multiple units, the Class 101 is a favorite of early diesel fans and now available in Regional Railways livery for Train Simulator 2021. More than 500 sets of the Class 101 were built by Metro-Cammell Works in Birmingham from 1956.

name: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Rebuilt Patriot Class Steam Loco
summary: Train Simulator 2021: LMS Rebuilt Patriot Class Steam Loco brings more classic steam to virtual life in Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: E18 Loco
summary: The E18 Passenger Add-On takes you back to West Germany in the 1970s and places you in the cab on an E18 electric locomotive hauling passenger services.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Clear Creek Old Timer Rolling Stock Pack
summary: The popular Clear Creek Narrow Gauge route for Train Simulator 2021 provides the opportunity to step back in time - to steam-era Colorado railroading in the 1930s. And now, the Clear Creek Old Timer Rolling Stock Pack transports you back even further - to the captivating era of narrow-gauge Rockies railroading during the 1890s!

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 33 Loco
summary: The Class 33 'Crompton' is a classic British Rail Southern Region diesel locomotive, and is ready to get to work for you in Train Simulator 2021. The Class 33 first appeared in British Rail Green livery in 1960 and was deployed in the south east.

name: Train Simulator 2021: BR Class 52 Loco
summary: One of the classic early diesel era locomotives, the Class 52, comes to Train Simulator 2021 as seen on mainline rail tours across the UK. Built by British Rail for the Western Region between 1961 and 1964, the Type 4 locomotive followed the Western Region's preference for diesel-hydraulic models.

name: Train Simulator 2021: GWR 1000 Class 'County Class' Steam Loco
summary: GWR's 1000 "County" Class now available for Train Simulator 2021, is a unique example in Great Western two-cylinder design worked hard for years, and yours to take to Devonian rails!

name: True Visions
summary: True Visions is a game where you can design houses from top to the bottom as an architect. Start your career as a freelancer, climb up step by step and establish your own company.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Arizona Divide - Winslow: Williams Route
summary: Climb aboard to experience fast-paced, challenging, and memorable railroading on the famed Santa Fe Railway, with the Arizona Divide: Winslow - Williams Route for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Union Pacific Big Boy Steam Loco
summary: The ultimate experience of taking the throttle of American steam - big steam - awaits you with the magnificent and extraordinary Union Pacific 4-8-8-4 Big Boy now available for Train Simulator 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Southern Pacific SD45 Loco
summary: The six-axle, 20 cylinder EMD SD 45 is now available for Train Simulator 2021 in Southern Pacific livery. Its powerful engine and versatility made the EMD SD 45 a popular class of locomotive among US railroads.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern GP60 Loco
summary: As a powerful and versatile modern locomotive, the Norfolk Southern EMD GP60 is also authentically suited for service on a variety of additional Train Simulator routes 2021!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern SD45 High Hoods Loco
summary: The popular EMD SD45 is now available for Train Simulator 2021 in three recognizable liveries of the Norfolk Southern Railway. Built between 1965 and 1971, the EMD SD45 was most at home hauling high-speed freight and intermodal services, although could occasionally be seen at the head of some passenger services.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Norfolk Southern Dash8-40C Loco
summary: As part of GE Transportation Systems' Dash 8 Series, the popular Dash8-40C is one of the most popular locomotives in the series, and is now available for Train Simulator 2021. Built by General Electric between 1987 and 1992, more than 500 Dash8-40C locomotives entered service for a number of US railroad companies.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Settle to Carlisle Route
summary: The Settle-Carlisle Expansion Pack is a superb modern recreation of this famous and beautiful British route, complete with 5 locomotives and rolling stock.

name: Train Simulator 2021: OEBB 4744 'Cityjet' EMU
summary: Get a taste of something modern with the state-of-the-art ÖBB (OEBB) 4744 'Cityjet' in Train Simulator 2021 in fully authentic fashion!

name: Trump Loves Russia
summary: Trump has been captured by the KGB and is being held in a bunker on a Soviet base. A dystopian adventure in which the USSR is still standing.

name: Train Simulator: BR/LNER Class J50 Loco Add-On
summary: The Gresley-designed Class J50 from Meshtools is now available for Train Simulator in a number of BR and LNER liveries.The origins of the Class J50 were in the Sir Nigel Gresley-designed Class J23, an 0-6-0T steam locomotive designed in 1913 for the purpose of working short-haul coal traffic in Yorkshire.

name: Train Simulator: RhB Enhancement Pack 02 Add-On
summary: Get ready for another helping of classic Arosa Line traction with the authentic RhB Enhancement Pack 02 for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: DB BR420 EMU Add-On
summary: The three-car BR 420 electric multiple unit (EMU) has plied its trade across many of Germany's city S-Bahn networks, and is now available for Train Simulator with scenarios for the Munich-Augsburg route.

name: Train Simulator: Network Southeast Class 205 'Thumper' DEMU Add-On
summary: Travel back to the waning years of the 20th Century with the iconic, superbly-detailed, Class 205 'Thumper'. Represented in absolute stunning detail, with authentic and characteristic sounds, expertly crafted, capturing the unmistakable character of these units.

name: Train Simulator: GWR Saint Class & Travelling Post Office Loco Add-On
summary: Delivering mail and hauling passengers was the Saint Class' staple throughout their operational lives, leaving London as the day comes to a close and passing through the Riviera Line in the shadow of night.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 27 Loco Add-On
summary: The mid-sized Class 27 diesel locomotive is now here for Train Simulator in British Rail Green livery.Built for British Rail between 1961 and 1962 by the Birmingham Railway Carriage and Wagon Company, the 69 models in the Class initially saw use around London and in Scotland.

name: Train Simulator: BNSF Locomotive Pack Add-On
summary: Three classic Electro-Motive second-generation diesels - the best-selling SD40-2, versatile GP38-2, and iconic F45 - in Burlington Northern and BNSF liveries are ready for Train Simulator service in this remarkable pack.

name: Train Simulator: Gatwick Express Class 442 'Wessex' EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 442 'Wessex Electric' (or 5WES) electric multiple unit (EMU) was introduced in 1988 on the South Western main line between London Waterloo and Weymouth. Their introduction coincided with the completion of the electrification from Bournemouth to Weymouth.

name: Train Simulator: RhB Enhancement Pack 01
summary: Take control of the unique UNESCO Branded Ge 4/4 III in this enhancement pack add-on for Train Simulator.The opening of the Vereina Tunnel, what would become the longest tunnel on the RhB, was projected to cause a major spike in both passenger and freight traffic across the mountainous network.

name: Train Simulator: First Capital Connect Class 319 EMU Add-On
summary: The modern, dual-voltage Class 319 EMU is here for Train Simulator in the familiar First Capital Connect livery as seen on Thameslink services out of London.Typical of EMUs built in the 1980s, the Class 319 was built by BREL York between 1987 and 1990 for north-south cross-London services from Bedford to Brighton, entering...

name: Train Simulator: D&RGW SD50 Loco Add-On
summary: Electro-Motive Division's powerful SD50 comes to Train Simulator from Digital Train Model. The SD50 from General Motors Electro-Motive Division was produced to counter increasingly tough competition from GE Transportation Systems' Dash 7 line, which was proving to be successful with US railroads.

name: Train Simulator: Class 86 Loco Add-On
summary: The Class 86 add-on brings classic British electric traction to Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Norfolk Southern GP50HH Loco Add-On
summary: The 3,500-horsepower Electro-Motive GP50 in unique "high-hood" configuration is now available for Train Simulator duty wearing Norfolk Southern’s distinctive livery.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 407 'New ICE 3' EMU Add-On
summary: Step aboard and get up to speed in Velaro family's latest and greatest iteration, the authentically crafted DB BR 407 'New ICE 3' delivers a "next level" high-speed experience to Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Fowler 4F Loco Add-On
summary: Designed by Henry Fowler the 4F is a class of 0-6-0 locomotive created primarily for medium freight work

name: Train Simulator: LNER BR Class 43 'High Speed Train' Remastered Loco Add-On
summary: Rediscover the "Journey Shrinker", as the instantly recognisable High Speed Train has been given a substantial upgrade in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: NJ TRANSIT U34CH Loco Add-On
summary: The distinctive, burly, and powerful General Electric U34CH diesel that toted commuters in New Jersey and New York for more than two decades is now available for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: Norfolk Southern GP33 ECO Loco Add-On
summary: In 2015 Norfolk Southern begin converting aged EMD GP50 diesels into like-new, highly efficient and environmental friendly GP33ECO diesels, which now come to Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: SBB RABe 523 EMU Add-On
summary: Climb the steep gradients and enjoy the incredible views taking this train along the Gotthardbahn, making sure to get your passengers to their destination safely. Get on board and master the SBB RABe 523!

name: Train Simulator: TGV Réseau & TGV-RDuplex EMU Add-On
summary: Complete with high fidelity visuals and 3 distinct variants, the TGV-Réseau & TGV-RDuplex make for a fantastic high-speed addition to your Train Simulator collection!

name: Train Simulator: LGV Rhône-Alpes & Méditerranée Route Extension Add-On
summary: LGV Rhône-Alpes & Méditerranée covers the line from Gare de Marseille-Saint-Charles to Lyon Gare de Lyon-Part-Dieu and Gare de Saint-Exupéry TGV, extending the original route threefold to bring a total of 309 km of breath-taking scenery and enthralling high-speed to Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Virgin Trains First Generation Pack Loco Add-On
summary: The Virgin Trains First Generation Pack brings classic cross-border action and 'dash of red' operations aboard famed traction.

name: Train Simulator: Tehachapi Pass: Mojave - Bakersfield Route Add-On
summary: Tehachapi! The name and the place stand among the pantheon of American railroading. And now, the legendary and rugged rail line shared by Union Pacific and BNSF comes to Train Simulator with Dovetail Games' Tehachapi Pass route!

name: Train Simulator: InterCity Class 91 Loco Add-On
summary: The flagship locomotive for the East Coast Main Line, the Class 91, speeds into Train Simulator in its original InterCity Swallow livery, complete with Mk4 coaches and Driving Van Trailer.The Class 91 was built as a development of the Advanced Passenger Train (APT) project, which was abandoned during the 1980s, and was introduced in 1988...

name: Train Simulator: LNER Raven Q6 Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Brace yourself for a real challenge as Victory Works bring Sir Vincent Raven’s powerful fleet of LNER Q6s to life on the Weardale & Teesdale Network - the first public route to use steam locomotives!

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific GP40X Loco Add-On
summary: Experience the experimental - with the Union Pacific Electro-Motive 3,500-horsepower GP40X for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: UP GE 44 Loco Add-On
summary: A Union Pacific Railroad switcher for the Cajon Pass.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 150/1 DMU Add-On
summary: This highly-detailed recreation with typical controls and cab features, puts you in the driving seat of one of Britain's iconic diesel multiple units. By the 1980s, British Rail were still operating a vast fleet of old Heritage DMUs, which dated back to the mid-1950s, across much of Britain’s rural and...

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 425 EMU Add-On
summary: Authentic regional running comes to life with Maik Goltz's incredibly detailed DB BR 425, which is ready for service in Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Clear Creek Log & Lumber Expansion Pack Add-On
summary: Across America in the 19th and early 20th centuries, small railroads busied themselves hauling logs and lumber. And now, the Clear Creek Log and Lumber Expansion Pack brings the captivating experience of steam-era logging and lumber railroading to Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: LNER Peppercorn Class K1 Loco Add-On
summary: The LNER Peppercorn K1 locomotives were built between 1949 and 1950, with the intention of splitting them between the North Eastern and Eastern Regions. Many K1s would regularly be seen as far north as Edinburgh and they were frequently used on the West Highland line in the early days.

name: Train Simulator: Miami Commuter Rail F40PHL-2 Loco Add-On
summary: The F40PHL-2 diesel locomotive is perfect for commuter services in sunny South Florida, and is now here for Train Simulator, complete with bi-level commuter coaches and driveable cab car.The F40PHL-2 is among the most unique and fascinating locomotives found in the U. S.

name: Train Simulator: GEML Class 90 Loco Add-On
summary: A mainstay of BR's locomotive fleet in the 1990s, the Class 90 was a replacement to BR's ageing fleet of electric locomotives, and is now available for Train Simulator in two liveries that are ideal for the Great Eastern Main Line London-Ipswich route.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR111 Loco Add-On
summary: The commuter BR111 electric locomotive seen across Germany since the 1970s is now available for Train Simulator, with accompanying DBbzf Control Car and double decker passenger coaches.

name: Train Simulator: Southern Pacific Cab Forward Loco Add-On
summary: The Southern Pacific Cab Forward is a classic oil-burner from the glory days of US Steam.

name: Train Simulator: Southeastern Class 465 EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 465 EMU is a popular sight across the south east of England on commuter services, and this modern four-car unit is now available for Train Simulator. The Class 465 'Networker' replaced the ageing Class 415 (4EPB) EMUs that were previously in service across the southern rail network.

name: Train Simulator: CPRR 4-6-0 Buffalo Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Smokebox, which has brought "Old West" railroading to full life in Train Simulator, now adds to the experience – with Central Pacific’s 1860s-era 4-6-0 "Buffalo!"

name: Train Simulator: BNSF ES44AC & SD40-2 Loco Add-On
summary: For more than 150 years, the BNSF Railway has provided the backbone of US freight transportation

name: Train Simulator: Konstanz - Villingen Route Extension: Villingen - Hausach
summary: Expand upon the stunning Konstanz - Villingen route with the even more impressive Black Forest extension to Hausach!

name: Train Simulator: Network Southeast Class 47 Loco Add-On
summary: Network SouthEast (NSE) was one of three passenger sectors Created by British Rail in 1982.

name: Train Simulator: ÖBB 1144 & CityShuttle Wiesel Loco Add-On
summary: Climb aboard iconic Austrian traction in the form of the advanced ÖBB 1144 and CityShuttle "Wiesel" from Skyhook Games and Railworks Austria!

name: Train Simulator: Green & Gold HST DMU Add-On
summary: In 1999, after acquisition by FirstGroup, Great Western Trains applied a revised livery to their existing stock without the need for repainting!

name: Train Simulator 2021: Bernina Pass - St Moritz: Poschiavo Route
summary: Climb the mountains and explore stunning Switzerland - Thomson Interactive's popular line-up of Swiss add-ons continues with the famed Bernina Pass.

name: Train Simulator: Metro North M2 EMU Add-On
summary: For nearly half-a-century, Metro-North's famed M2 electric-multiple-unit (EMU) trains carried commuters to and from New York City, earning the electrics, along with their younger M4 sisters, legendary status around the Big Apple - and now these American railroad classics come to Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: London Underground S7+1 EMU Add-On
summary: Experience state-of-the-art commuter traction in the form of Just Trains' stylish London Underground S7+1 Stock!

name: Train Simulator: RhB Enhancement Pack 05 Add-On
summary: Experience a touch of history with Rivet Games' RhB Enhancement Pack 05, which features a unique example of a Ge 6/6 II locomotive in classic RhB Green livery!

name: Train Simulator: InterCity BR Class 89 'Badger' Loco Add-On
summary: The BR Class 89 was a prototype electric locomotive that was set to transform the East Coast Main Line, and while reality went in a different direction, one cannot deny the unique and powerful design that was the "Badger", and this one-of-a-kind loco is available to drive in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: London Underground S8 EMU Add-On
summary: Experience state-of-the-art commuter traction in the form of Just Trains' stylish London Underground S8 Stock!

name: Train Simulator: Clinchfield Railroad U36C Loco Add-On
summary: Hauling ponderous coal trains through America's rugged Appalachian Mountains called for horsepower, lots of it, and in 1971 the famed Clinchfield Railroad purchased General Electric's U36C diesel, then one of the most power locomotives in the world.

name: Train Simulator: ÖBB 1822 Loco Add-On
summary: Built in the early 1990s, the ÖBB 1822 was designed as a mixed-traffic locomotive specifically for conquering the challenging Brenner Pass, as well as being able to be used on both Austria’s and Italy's differing electrification systems. Experience the stylish ÖBB 1822 from RSSLO in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: GWR Pannier Tank Pack Add-On
summary: Delve into the Great Western once more with the famed and versatile GWR Pannier Tanks!

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 423 '4VEP' EMU Add-On
summary: The 4VEP Add-On takes you back to the days of the classic 'slam-door' commuter trains on the Woking-Portsmouth Line.

name: Train Simulator: Canadian National SD70 Loco Add-On
summary: Climb into a classic EMD Spartan Cab and do some heavy hauling - with the Canadian National Electro-Motive 4,000-horsepower SD70 for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: DB BR143 Loco Add-On
summary: The BR143 Add-On offers one of the most accurate and involving locomotive driving experiences currently available for Train Simulator 2012.

name: Train Simulator: DB ICE 2 EMU Add-On
summary: The second-generation Deutsche Bahn ICE 2 is synonymous with stylish high speed train travel in Germany, and now you can take control of this cool express train in Train Simulator.The ICE 2 is the second class of high speed train serving the German railway network, built between 1995 and 1997 as an enhanced high speed unit to its...

name: Train Simulator: Bulleid Q1 Class Loco Add-On
summary: The 'ugly duckling' of Southern steam is now here for Train Simulator, brought to you by Victory Works. World War II halted production of steam locomotives in the UK, but a large increase in goods traffic across the country forced a shortage of suitable motive power for the Southern Railway.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Canadian Mountain Passes - Revelstoke-Lake Louise
summary: Canada's first transcontinental railway through the dramatic Rocky Mountains comes to life in this beautiful new route for Train Simulator, featuring imposing mountain passes, steep gradients and famous spiral tunnels.

name: Train Simulator: DR BR 24 Loco Add-On
summary: A workhorse of German and Polish railways, the BR 24 'Steppenpferd' comes to Train Simulator from Romantic Railroads. The 'Steppenpferd' ('Prairie Horse') was developed specifically for the long, flat routes in West and East Prussia between 1928 and 1940 as passenger locomotives.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 152 Loco Add-On
summary: The mixed-traffic BR 152 is one of the most popular locomotives among drivers seen on Germany's railways today. The high performance ES64F locomotive built by Siemens forms part of the company's EuroSprinter range, and started life as a mixed traffic locomotive.

name: Train Simulator: Norfolk Southern SD60E Loco Add-On
summary: Norfolk Southern’s distinctive SD60E rebuilt locomotive, featuring the railroad's unique "Crescent Cab," is now available for Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: BR Standard Class 7 'Britannia Class' Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Experience the beauty of the Britannia with Just Trains' BR Standard Class 7 locomotive!

name: Train Simulator: Rebuilt Bulleid Light Pacific Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Oliver Bulleids' finest work, the Rebuilt Light Pacifics of the Southern Railway, in this superb Pro-Range rendition of the class courtesy of Partner Programme developer, Just Trains.

name: Train Simulator: N15 King Arthur Class 'Sir Lamiel' Loco Add-On
summary: Become King of the railway with the new N15 King Arthur Class for Train Simulator, recreating the only preserved locomotive in the Class, 'Sir Lamiel'.

name: Train Simulator: Battle For Sherman Hill Add-On
summary: The Battle for Sherman Hill delivers the ultimate railroading experience, Union Pacific's crossing of America's Continental Divide. With "The Battle for Sherman Hill," you will tackle the challenges of moving heavy freight throughout the decades, from the steam era to the railroading of today!

name: Train Simulator: Class 67 Diamond Jubilee Loco Add-On
summary: Drive the Queen aboard the Royal Train to her Jubilee Celebrations, pulled by the Class 67 Diesel Electric locomotive.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 605 ICE TD Add-On
summary: One of Germany's most modern diesel multiple units speeds into Train Simulator, with the ICE TD joining the popular ICE fleet.

name: Train Simulator: Thompson Class B1 Loco Add-On
summary: The London and North Eastern Railway's mixed traffic Thompson B1 Class locomotive for Train Simulator includes scenarios specially created for the popular Woodhead Line.

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 58 Loco Add-On
summary: The distinctive Class 58, nicknamed the 'Bone' because of its unusual shape with a wide cab at either end, is now available to lend some serious hauling power in Train Simulator. The Class 58 was built between 1983 and 1987 by BREL in Doncaster Works as British Rail wanted a new freight locomotive that would be lower in cost and...

name: Train Simulator: Western Pacific GP35 Add-On
summary: The Electro-Motive 2,500-horsepower GP35 was a railroading success story, with more than 1,300 of the locomotives sold to 40 original railroad buyers during its 1963-1966 production run.

name: Train Simulator: Class 57 Rail Tour Loco Add-On
summary: The re-engineered, multi-purpose Class 57 locomotive in special Rail Tours livery, with scenarios created for the Settle-Carlisle route, is now available for Train Simulator. Rebuilt from the Class 47, the Class 57s entered service in 1997 and are affectionately known as 'Bodysnatchers' or 'Zombies', by virtue of their modification from...

name: Train Simulator: Chessie System Retro Pack
summary: Take the throttle of the Chessie System's magnificent and diverse motive power and enjoy classic railroading amid the historic farmlands and scenic mountains of Maryland and Pennsylvania - with the Chessie System Retro Pack!

name: Train Simulator: BR GT3 Turbine Loco Add-On
summary: One of the more unusual locomotives ever to be built, the GT3 Gas Turbine Prototype is nevertheless part of British railway history and is now available for Train Simulator from Victory Works.The GT3 was part of a programme for the development of gas turbine locomotives started in the late 1940s.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 146.5 & BR 668.2 ‘Intercity 2’ Loco Add-On
summary: Experience modern passenger traction in the form of DB's stylish "IC2", which is ready for service in Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: BR 266 Loco Add-On
summary: The modern and low-emission BR 266 comes to Train Simulator, ideal for running freight services on Germany's extensive rail network. Built in Canada by General Motors, the BR 266 is based on the UK's Class 66 diesel locomotive, externally resembling the UK locomotive in appearance but with a different internal control desk to accommodate...

name: Train Simulator: LNER Class V2 Steam Loco Add-On
summary: Experience a true workhorse of the LNER, the authentic and advanced LNER V2 locomotive from Just Trains!

name: Train Simulator: New Haven E-33 Loco Add-On
summary: Built by General Electric in the 1950s to haul coal for the Virginian Railway, a group of 3,300-horsepower ignitron rectifier electrics were purchased second-hand in 1963 by the New Haven Railroad to haul tonnage between New York City and New Haven, Connecticut.

name: Train Simulator 2021: Frankfurt High Speed - Frankfurt: Karlsruhe Route Extension
summary: Stretching across the Rhine Valley and the Hessian Ried, Frankfurt High Speed: Frankfurt - Karlsruhe is a definitive and landmark arrival in Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: New Haven DL-109 Loco Add-On
summary: Take the throttle of a pioneering, and stylish, American diesel locomotive - with the New Haven Alco DL109 for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: NJ TRANSIT Arrow III EMU Add-On
summary: NJ Transit's classic Arrow III electric-multiple-unit railcars began rolling out of General Electric's erecting halls four decades ago and have since become an iconic fixture of New Jersey's commuter railroading scene, serving on many NJ Transit routes including the North Jersey Coast Line, Morristown Line, and Northeast Corridor.

name: Train Simulator: PRR GG1 Loco Add-On
summary: The GG1 electric locomotive is a true icon of North American railroading.

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific SD45 Loco Add-On
summary: The EMD SD45 was one of the first standard North American diesel locomotives to use a 20 cylinder diesel engine.

name: Train Simulator: GEML BR Class 315 EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 315 fleet has spent 38 years working both the GEML, the Lea Valley Lines, and occasionally stretching further afield to the likes of Braintree - however their most notable work is the stopping 'metro' services between London and Shenfield, a distance of around 20 miles.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 112.1 Loco Add-On
summary: Take control of the iconic DB BR 112.1 in this Pro Range addition for Train Simulator.In the wake of the 1973 Oil Crisis, Deutsche Reichsbahn were looking to reinstate their electrification of East Germany.

name: Train Simulator: ÖBB 1142 Loco Add-On
summary: In recent years, some locomotives have been retired, or been sold to other operators in Europe, however ÖBB still retain a fleet of 45 for their own use. All told, for a design pushing through its mid-50s, the ÖBB 1142 represents an outstanding feat of engineering.

name: Train Simulator: Los Angeles Commuter Rail F59PH Loco Add-On
summary: Based on the GP59, the first in the F59 Series - the F59PH - is a common diesel electric locomotive used by a number of North American railroads. The F59PH, built by General Motors Electro-Motive Division, offered a more fuel efficiency and more efficient driving conditions than its predecessors.

name: Train Simulator: ÖBB 4023 ‘Talent' EMU Add-On
summary: First designed in the 1990s, the Talent truly is the forefront of modern European transportation for both passengers and drivers alike. With such sparks as the ever-successful Talent 2 in its legacy, the Austrian Federal Railway can be proud of operating such a uniquely versatile EMU.

name: Train Simulator: Southern Pacific GE 44 Loco Add-On
summary: The hard-working GE 44 Tonner switcher is now available for Train Simulator in Southern Pacific livery.More than 340 GE 44 Tonners were built and were originally designed for industrial and light switching duties, often replacing steam locomotives as diesel power became more widely used in the US.

name: Train Simulator: EWS & Freightliner Class 08s Loco Add-On
summary: Once one of the most common sights on the British railway network, the Class 08 diesel shunter is now available for Train Simulator in the modern EWS and Freightliner liveries. The Class 08 was the 'go to' locomotive for general purpose duties, with almost any shunting required in yards and at stations carried out by a 'Gronk'.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 440 ‘Coradia Continental’ Loco Add-On
summary: Expand your collection of modern German passenger trains with the introduction of the DB BR 440 to Train Simulator.The DB BR 440, or Coradia Continental is a family of high speed commuter trains designed for S-Bahn services throughout Germany.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 218 Loco Add-On
summary: As the last of the DB V160 family of locomotives, the BR 218 was the backbone of the Deutsche Bundesbahn's main line diesel locomotive traction from the 1970s up to the reunification of Germany, and is now here for Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: PRR GE 44 Loco Add-On
summary: A small but tough switching locomotive for the Horseshoe Curve.

name: Train Simulator: GWR Class 14XX Loco Add-On
summary: One of the Great Western Railway's most iconic tank engines, the Class 14XX, comes to Train Simulator complete with GWR autocoach.

name: Train Simulator: DB BR 151 Loco Add-On
summary: The powerfully competitive, and superbly detailed, DB BR 151 arrives for heavy-freight operations in Train Simulator courtesy of Partner Programme developer Virtual Railroads

name: Train Simulator: ScotRail Class 68 Loco Add-on
summary: Expand your Train Simulator collection with this state-of-the-art powerful, mixed traffic Class 68 locomotive.The diesel-electric Class 68, initially built between 2013 and 2014 for Direct Rail Services, was derived from the Eurolight family of locomotives and known as the UKLight by manufacturer Vossloh.

name: Train Simulator: SŽ Series 363 Loco Add-On
summary: Unique electric action comes to life with RSSLO's striking SŽ Series 363 locomotive for Train Simulator!

name: Train Simulator: CRH380D EMU Add-On
summary: High-speed Chinese rail services were first introduced in 2007 and operated with existing CRH (China Railways) rolling stock running on existing lines which had been upgraded for speeds of up to 250 km/h (160 mph) and on newer dedicated high-speed track rated up to 350 km/h (220 mph).

name: Train Simulator: Class J94 ‘Memories of Maerdy’ Loco Add-On
summary: PRO RANGE The Pro Range is aimed toward the serious train simulation enthusiast looking for a complex machine to master. Each product is designed to provide education and entertainment for users. Xbox controller and HUD interface support do not come as standard and users will need to read the accompanying documentation to fully...

name: Train Simulator: Regional Railways BR Class 142 'Pacer' DMU
summary: The Classic BR Class 142 'Pacer' arrives for service in Train Simulator, emanating authentic 1980s vibes!

name: Train Simulator: Southern Class 421 ‘4CIG’ EMU Add-On
summary: The 4CIG is a classic 'slam door' electric multiple unit and is now available in Southern livery with scenarios for the London to Brighton Expansion Pack.

name: Train Simulator: Southern Pacific SD45T-2 Loco Add-On
summary: Southern Pacific's Electro-Motive SD45T-2 was born to battle mountains – and now the famed and rugged SP "Tunnel Motor" is ready for Train Simulator service!

name: Train Simulator: BR Class 40 '40145' Loco Add-On
summary: One of the first mass produced diesel-electric locomotive classes for British Railways, the Class 40, comes to Train Simulator, from developer RailRight. A total of 200 'Whistlers' (so called because of their distinctive turbo whistle sound) were built by English Electric over a four year period from 1958, and were - for a time...

name: Train Simulator: BR Standard Class 2MT Loco Add-On
summary: The smallest of British Railway's Standard class locomotives, the BR Standard Class 2MT, is now available for Train Simulator. Originally derived from the Ivatt-designed Class 2MT for the London, Midland and Scottish Railway, the BR Standard Class 2MT was designed by R.A.

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific DD35 Add-On
summary: Joining the US roster of heavy freight locomotives in Train Simulator is the impressive EMD DD35 and GP35 from DigitalTrainModel.The EMD DD35 was a 5,000hp (3,700kW) diesel-electric locomotive of built by General Motors Electro-Motive Division for the Union Pacific Railroad and Southern Pacific Railroad.

name: Train Simulator: First Capital Connect Class 377 EMU Add-On
summary: The Class 377 'Electrostar' is Britain's most common Electric Multiple Unit and a favourite of London commuters, and now you can drive this advanced passenger train on Train Simulator.

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific U50 Loco Add-On
summary: Take the throttle of one of the biggest and most distinctive diesel locomotives ever to serve on America's railroads - with the Union Pacific General Electric U50.

name: Train Simulator: Union Pacific DDA40X Centennial Loco Add-On
summary: The EMD DDA40X comes to Train Simulator, and talk about arriving in style - with 6,600hp and a mammoth length of 98ft, the DDA40X says it loud and clear: 'if you're gonna have a locomotive, have a LOCOMOTIVE!'.

name: Train Simulator: Metro-North P32 AC-DM 'Genesis' Loco Add-On
summary: The dual mode P32 AC-DM comes to Train Simulator for the NEC: New York-New Haven route in Metro-North livery. The General Electric designed 'Genesis' series were built between 1992 and 2001 for Amtrak, Metro-North and Via Rail.

name: Train Simulator: Nuremberg & Regensburg Bahn
summary: Take charge of vital passenger and freight services over stunning Bavarian terrain with the famed Nuremberg-Regensburg Railway, which is exclusively available with Train Simulator 2020!

name: Train Conductor
